Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with two men wearing short tunics and cloaks, carrying the Sacred Couch of Sarapis; between them is Pan (?) playing the pipes. The angular shoulder is decorated with a wreath in relief, interrupted by grooved rectangular panels each side. At the rear is an Egyptian ring handle. Within the multiple base-ring is a central impressed point. Covered with a brown slip, fired dark grey-brown over a large area.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2077)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine (trustees)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
